intro: Dictyocaryum schultzei, commonly known as the African nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and a dense covering of fine, stinging hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in racemes and are typically borne on slender stalks. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
